00044 static unsigned int object_count = 0;
00045 
00046 EGS_Object::EGS_Object(const string &Name, EGS_ObjectFactory *f) :
00047     nref(0), otype("EGS_Object"), name(Name), factory(f) {
00048     object_count++;
00049     if( !name.size() ) name = getUniqueName(this);
00050     //if( factory ) factory->addObject(this);
00051 }
00052 
00053 EGS_Object::EGS_Object(EGS_Input *input, EGS_ObjectFactory *f) :
00054     nref(0), otype("EGS_Object"), name(""), factory(f) {
00055     object_count++;
00056     setName(input);
00057     //if( factory ) factory->addObject(this);
00058 }
00059 
00060 EGS_Object::~EGS_Object() {
00061     //egsWarning("Destruncting object of type %s with name %s\n",
00062     //     otype.c_str(),name.c_str());
00063     if( factory ) factory->removeObject(this);
00064 }
00065 
00066 void EGS_Object::setFactory(EGS_ObjectFactory *f) {
00067     if( f && f != factory ) {
00068         if( factory ) factory->removeObject(this);
00069         factory = f; factory->addObject(this);
00070     }
00071 }
00072 
00073 string EGS_Object::getUniqueName(const EGS_Object *o) {
00074     char buf[256];
00075     if( o ) sprintf(buf,"%s_%d",o->getObjectType().c_str(),object_count);
00076     else sprintf(buf,"object_%d",object_count);
00077     string result(buf); return result;
00078 }
00079 
00080 void EGS_Object::setName(EGS_Input *input) {
00081     int err = 1;
00082     if( input ) err = input->getInput("name",name);
00083     if( err ) name = getUniqueName(this);
00084 }
00085 
00086 EGS_ObjectFactory::EGS_ObjectFactory(const string &dsoPath, int where) {
00087     //egsWarning("Creating object factory at 0x%x\n",this);
00088     if( egsIsAbsolutePath(dsoPath) ) dso_path = dsoPath;
00089     else {
00090         static const char* locations[] = {"HEN_HOUSE","EGS_HOME"};
00091         int i = !where ? 0 : 1;
00092         char *loc = getenv(locations[i]);
00093         if( !loc )
00094             egsFatal("EGS_ObjectFactory: the environment variable "
00095                         "%s must be defined\n",locations[i]);
00096         dso_path = egsJoinPath(loc,dsoPath);
00097     }
00098 }
00099 
00100 EGS_ObjectFactory::~EGS_ObjectFactory() {
00101     unsigned int j;
00102     //egsWarning("Destructing object factory at 0x%x\n",this);
00103     //egsWarning("  - destructing known objects\n");
00104     for(j=0; j<known_objects.size(); j++)
00105         EGS_Object::deleteObject(known_objects[j]);
00106     //egsWarning("  - destructing added objects, objects size is %d\n",
00107     //        objects.size());
00108     for(j=0; j<objects.size(); j++) {
00109         EGS_Object *o = objects[j];
00110         //egsWarning("Deleting object at 0x%x of type %s with name %s\n",
00111         //        o,o->getObjectType().c_str(),o->getObjectName().c_str());
00112         EGS_Object::deleteObject(o);
00113     }
00114     //egsWarning("  - unloading libraries\n");
00115     for(j=0; j<libs.size(); j++) delete libs[j];
00116 }
00117 
00118 void EGS_ObjectFactory::removeObject(EGS_Object *o) {
00119     for(vector<EGS_Object *>::iterator i = objects.begin();
00120             i != objects.end(); i++) {
00121         if( o == *i ) {
00122             // why not calling o->deref() here ?
00123             objects.erase(i);
00124             break;
00125         }
00126     }
00127 }
00128 
00129 typedef EGS_Object* (*EGS_ObjectCreationFunction)(EGS_Input *,
00130                                                   EGS_ObjectFactory *);
00131 
00132 EGS_Object* EGS_ObjectFactory::createObjects(EGS_Input *i,
00133         const string &section_delimeter, const string &object_delimeter,
00134         const string &select_key, const char *funcname, bool unique) {
00135     if( !i ) {
00136         egsWarning("EGS_ObjectFactory::createObjects(): null input?\n");
00137         return 0;
00138     }
00139     EGS_Input *input = i;
00140     if( !i->isA(section_delimeter) ) {
00141         input = i->takeInputItem(section_delimeter);
00142         if( !input ) {
00143             egsWarning("EGS_ObjectFactory::createObjects(): the input is"
00144                " not of type %s and also does not have items of this type\n",
00145                section_delimeter.c_str()); return 0;
00146         }
00147     }
00148     EGS_Input *ij; int errors = 0;
00149     while( (ij = input->takeInputItem(object_delimeter)) != 0 ) {
00150         EGS_Object *o = createSingleObject(ij,funcname,unique);
00151         if( !o ) errors++;
00152         delete ij;
00153     }
00154     if( errors ) egsWarning("EGS_ObjectFactory::createObjects(): %d errors"
00155             " occured while creating objects\n",errors);
00156     string sought_object; EGS_Object *o = 0;
00157     if( objects.size() > 0 ) o = objects[objects.size()-1];
00158     int err = input->getInput(select_key,sought_object);
00159     if( !err ) {
00160         o = getObject(sought_object);
00161         if( !o ) egsWarning("EGS_ObjectFactory::createObjects(): an object "
00162                 "with the name %s does not exist\n",sought_object.c_str());
00163     }
00164     return o;
00165 }
00166 
00167 EGS_Object* EGS_ObjectFactory::createSingleObject(EGS_Input *i,
00168         const char *funcname, bool unique) {
00169     if( !i ) {
00170         egsWarning("EGS_ObjectFactory::createSingleObject(): null input?\n");
00171         return 0;
00172     }
00173     string type; int err = i->getInput("type",type);
00174     if( !err ) {
00175         for(unsigned int j=0; j<known_objects.size(); j++) {
00176             if( i->compare(type,known_objects[j]->getObjectType()) ) {
00177                 EGS_Object *o = known_objects[j]->createObject(i);
00178                 if( addObject(o,unique) ) return o;
00179                 EGS_Object::deleteObject(o); return 0;
00180             }
00181         }
00182     }
00183     string libname;
00184     int error = i->getInput("library",libname);
00185     if( error ) {
00186         if( err ) egsWarning("EGS_ObjectFactory::createObject(): \n"
00187             "  input item %s does not define an object type or an object "
00188             "library\n",i->name());
00189         else egsWarning("EGS_ObjectFactory::createObject(): input item %s\n"
00190             "  don't know anything about object type %s and no object"
00191             "library defined\n",i->name(),type.c_str());
00192         return 0;
00193     }
00194     EGS_Library *lib = 0;
00195     for(unsigned int j=0; j<libs.size(); j++) {
00196         if( libname == libs[j]->libraryName() ) {
00197             lib = libs[j]; break;
00198         }
00199     }
00200     if( !lib ) {
00201         lib = new EGS_Library(libname.c_str(),dso_path.c_str());
00202         lib->load();
00203         if( !lib->isLoaded() ) {
00204             egsWarning("EGS_ObjectFactory::createObject(): "
00205                 "failed to load the library %s from %s\n",
00206                 libname.c_str(),dso_path.c_str());
00207             return 0;
00208         }
00209         libs.push_back(lib);
00210     }
00211     EGS_ObjectCreationFunction create;
00212     const char *fname = funcname ? funcname : "createObject";
00213     create = (EGS_ObjectCreationFunction) lib->resolve(fname);
00214     if( !create ) {
00215         egsWarning("EGS_ObjectFactory::createObject():\n"
00216          "  failed to resolve the '%s' function in the library %s\n",
00217          fname,lib->libraryName());
00218         return 0;
00219     }
00220     EGS_Object *o = create(i,this);
00221     if( addObject(o,unique) ) return o;
00222     EGS_Object::deleteObject(o); return 0;
00223 }
00224 
00225 bool EGS_ObjectFactory::addObject(EGS_Object *o, bool unique) {
00226     if( !o ) {
00227         egsWarning("EGS_ObjectFactory::addObject(): attempt to add a null"
00228                 " object\n"); return false;
00229     }
00230     for(unsigned int j=0; j<objects.size(); j++) {
00231         if( objects[j] == o ) return true;
00232     }
00233     if( unique ) {
00234         for(unsigned int j=0; j<objects.size(); j++) {
00235             if( o->getObjectName() == objects[j]->getObjectName() ) {
00236                 egsWarning("EGS_ObjectFactory::addObject(): an object with "
00237                     "the name %s already exists\n",o->getObjectName().c_str());
00238                 //if( o->deref() == -1 ) delete o;
00239                 return false;
00240             }
00241         }
00242     }
00243     //egsWarning("adding an object with name '%s' of type '%s' at 0x%x\n",
00244     //        o->getObjectName().c_str(),o->getObjectType().c_str(),o);
00245     objects.push_back(o); o->setFactory(this); return true;
00246 }
00247 
00248 bool EGS_ObjectFactory::haveObject(const EGS_Object *o) const {
00249     for(unsigned int j=0; j<objects.size(); j++) {
00250         if( objects[j] == o ) return true;
00251     }
00252     return false;
00253 }
00254 
00255 EGS_Object* EGS_ObjectFactory::getObject(const string &name) {
00256     for(unsigned int j=0; j<objects.size(); j++) {
00257         if( name == objects[j]->getObjectName() )
00258             return objects[j];
00259     }
00260     return 0;
00261 }
00262 
00263 EGS_Object* EGS_ObjectFactory::takeObject(const string &name) {
00264     for(vector<EGS_Object *>::iterator i = objects.begin();
00265             i != objects.end(); i++) {
00266         if( (*i)->getObjectName() == name ) {
00267             (*i)->deref(); objects.erase(i); return *i;
00268         }
00269     }
00270     return 0;
00271 }
00272 
00273 void EGS_ObjectFactory::addKnownTypeId(const char *typeid_name) {
00274     if( !typeid_name ) return;
00275     for(int j=0; j<known_typeids.size(); j++)
00276         if( known_typeids[j] == typeid_name ) return;
00277     known_typeids.push_back(typeid_name);
00278 }
